text: <!here> does anyone know a good way to make forms selectable in a custom widget? I'm building a section widget with two columns, one will have text and and an image and the other side will have a form. I'd like to have the widget so every-time its applied on a page the person building the page can select a different form from within the page editor.
The best I've come up with is embedding the form and having the form id set as a variable. But the form id isn't easily accessible so I'm not sure this will work for teammates.
Please try to refrain from using atHere, there are like 300+ people in this slack channel, and that notifies all of them
Will the list of forms be changing?
I'm not sure what you mean?
The forms that your end use can select, would you be changing which ones could be added to the page? or is there a set number that will only be available to be embedded?

To be honest I probably could just embedded the one form for this purpose. But I like to make my code reusable so if there is a way for the widget to have a way to change the form in the page editor that would be awesome.
So yes I want a way to change to any form for each page the widget is added to.
I couldn't find a way online but I figured I'd toss it in here incase anyone has faced this issue before.
why not use the form module?
I'm building a custom module.
I want to use the form module but I need to hard coded it in.
I'm not sure if that is available though.

I am not sure if that is possible unless there is an option to get dynamically a list of all forms and create a drop-down to select which form you want (I don't think that is available).  The closest approach to what you want, probably is to create the custom module without the form and add the form module side by side with the custom module which will be a text. i.e. 6 col custom module (text) on the left 6 col form module on the right.

For sure, yeah I was hoping there was some way to leverage the form module in a custom module :disappointed: I do want to keep whole section in a custom module because it removes some of HubSpots wrapping html. I guess I'll use the form id as a variable for the time.

In the old Design Manager you can use the form module as documented here: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules#form>
In the new Design Manager there's a form field available in the IDE.
if you are using the new design manager (Beta) you might be able to do it in a local module. Or wait a bit longer until is going to be launched officially.
ah awesome.
Thanks guys!
